answer:
The routine immunization schedule is intended for residents of BC and is publicly funded (free). Read the list of individuals eligible for the hepatitis B vaccine here. For adults, the hepatitis B vaccine is typically given at 0, 1, 6 months. Immunization appointments can be booked at a local health unit; find a location near you here.
If you are not a resident of BC, vaccines may be available for purchase from some doctors' offices, pharmacies (for those 5 years of age and older) and travel health clinics.  Services vary across BC. Bring your vaccine records to any immunization appointment.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## The routine immunization schedule is intended for residents of BC and is publicly funded (free).

Read the list of individuals eligible for the hepatitis B vaccine here.
For adults, the hepatitis B vaccine is typically given at 0, 1, 6 months.
Immunization appointments can be booked at a local health unit;find a location near you here.

## If you are not a resident of BC, vaccines may be available for purchase from some doctors' offices, pharmacies (for those 5 years of age and older) and travel health clinics.

Services vary across BC.
Bring your vaccine records to any immunization appointment.

## Immunization Nurse
question: I had Hepatitis B vaccine injection in South Korea (June&August,2018). So I was wondering where can I get my third injection in Vancouver. I don't have neither PR Card/citizenship.
question_variation_0: where can i get my hepatitis b injection injection in south korea
question_variation_1: where can i get vaccine in south korea
